newsitem.title: GERMANY: German ad industry to launch billboard inspections.
newsitem.headline: German ad industry to launch billboard inspections.

text.p: The German advertising industry should have a new quality-control system for inspecting billboards in place by October, an industry watchdog group said on Wednesday.

Advertising industry association Informationsgemeinschaft zur Feststellung der Verbreitung von Werbetraegern (IVW) said the new scheme would entail visiting billboard sites to ensure they correspond with companies' advertising sales agreements.
When implemented, about 75 percent of all billboards in Germany will be checked for proper location, cleanliness and compliance with customers' orders, the IVW said.
"The IVW inspection will offer companies that advertise and advertising agencies decisive security in implementing their outdoor advertising," the IVW said in a statement.
It added that 34 companies with nearly 300,000 billboards had already registered for the programme.
The IVW is an ad industry organisation financed by media companies, ad agencies and companies that invest in advertising.
